pack.congrats_message: You've completed all {{count}} challenges in this pack!
pack.author: Author
pack.fallback_description: Master SQL fundamentals with {{count}} interactive challenges

challenge.solution_warning: Try to understand why this solution works, not just copy it. Look at each part of the query and think about what it does.
challenge.success_message: Excellent work! You've mastered this SQL concept.
challenge.not_quite_message: Your code is close, but doesn't pass all tests. Take a look at the errors below.

concepts.title: SQL Concepts
concepts.subtitle: Learn SQL concepts with clear explanations, examples, and interactive demonstrations. Master the fundamentals before diving into challenges.

categories.fundamentals_desc: Essential SQL concepts every beginner should know
categories.aggregation_desc: Summarize and analyze data with aggregate functions
categories.combining_desc: Work with multiple tables using JOINs

concepts.ready_practice_desc: Now that you understand the concepts, try applying them in our interactive challenges.

step1.title: Welcome to SQL Learn! ðŸŽ‰
step1.intro: SQL Learn is an interactive platform to master SQL through hands-on practice. Learn by doing with real datasets and immediate feedback.

step2.title: Two Ways to Learn
step2.path1_desc: New to SQL? Begin with our concept pages that explain SELECT, WHERE, ORDER BY, GROUP BY, and JOINs with interactive examples.
step2.path2_desc: Already know some SQL? Start with challenge packs and learn by solving real problems with instant feedback.

step3.title: Pro Tips for Success ðŸ’¡
step3.tip1_desc: Stuck? Each challenge has 3 levels of hints - start with gentle nudges and progress to more detailed guidance if needed.
step3.tip2_desc: Our error messages are beginner-friendly and suggest fixes. They'll help you learn from mistakes.
step3.tip3_desc: Consistency beats intensity. Try to solve 2-3 challenges per day to build strong SQL skills.
step3.tip4_desc: Each challenge shows table schemas. Click to expand and see column names and types before writing queries.

errors.table_not_found: Table '{{table}}' not found. Did you mean '{{suggestion}}' (plural)?
errors.table_not_found_generic: Table '{{table}}' doesn't exist. Check your spelling and make sure the table name is correct.
errors.column_not_found: Column '{{column}}' not found. Make sure this column exists in your table. Try using SELECT * first to see all available columns.
errors.column_not_found_generic: Column not found. Check your column names and make sure they're spelled correctly.
errors.syntax_form_from: Syntax error: Did you mean 'FROM' instead of 'FORM'? SQL keywords must be spelled exactly right.
errors.syntax_were_where: Syntax error: Did you mean 'WHERE' instead of 'WERE'?
errors.syntax_missing_comma: Syntax error: Missing comma. When selecting multiple columns, separate them with commas: SELECT col1, col2, col3
errors.syntax_generic: Syntax error: {{message}}. Double-check your SQL keywords and punctuation.
errors.aggregate_group_by: When using aggregate functions like COUNT(), SUM(), or AVG(), you need to add GROUP BY for any columns that aren't aggregated.
errors.type_mismatch: Type mismatch: You're trying to compare values of different types (like comparing a number to text). Make sure your comparisons use compatible types.
errors.timeout: Query took too long to run (limit: {{timeout}}ms). Try simplifying your query or filtering data earlier.
errors.unknown_error: Unknown error occurred. Please check your SQL syntax.
errors.row_limit: Query returned {{returned}} rows, exceeding limit of {{limit}}
